conclusion: Calculate the induced electromotive force (EMF) in a rectangular coil that rotates around a symmetry axis.
Identify the given values: Magnetic induction intensity B = 0.1 T, Number of turns n = 100, Side lengths l_AB = 0.2 m and l_BC = 0.5 m, Angular velocity ω = 100π rad/s.
Calculate the magnetic flux through the rectangular coil using the formula φ = B × l_AB × l_BC × sin(θ).
Since the coil rotates around the symmetry axis, the angle θ is 90° (since l_AB and l_BC are perpendicular to the axis).
Calculate the magnetic flux: φ = 0.1 × 0.2 × 0.5 × sin(90°) = 0.01 Wb.
The induced EMF E is given by E = n × φ × ω.
Substitute the given values into the formula: E = 100 × 0.01 × 100π = 314.16 V.
The magnitude of the induced electromotive force is 314.16 V.
